summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between Glen McGorty, a managing partner at Crowell & Moring LLP, and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY). The emails discuss arranging a call to convey information to McGorty's client (referred to as 'Mr. [redacted]') regarding an individual named [redacted], a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee in Saint Thomas who had a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein and accompanied him on trips. The prosecutors are seeking to determine if McGorty's client recognizes this individual.

persons.name: Glen McGorty
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed client ('Mr. [redacted]') in communications with federal prosecutors regarding an investigation connected to Jeffrey Epstein. He facilitates the exchange of information.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Appears as a recipient/cc on the email chain, likely involved in the legal proceedings or investigation.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Appears as a recipient/cc on the email chain, likely involved in the legal proceedings or investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as having had a friendship with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee named [redacted], who visited Epstein's home and accompanied him on trips.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Referenced in a forwarded email from 2019 regarding scheduling a meeting, identified as a board-certified criminal trial lawyer.

connections.description: McGorty is the attorney for the unnamed client 'Mr. [redacted]', conveying information from prosecutors and arranging communication.
Described as having a friendship with Epstein, visiting his home in the Virgin Islands, and accompanying him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
Prosecutors suggest [redacted] may have introduced one or more individuals to Mr. [redacted] at a bar or other location in the Virgin Islands.
Professional communication regarding an ongoing investigation, with prosecutors seeking information from McGorty's client.

events.title: Prosecutors Reach Out with Photo Inquiry
events.description: Federal prosecutors (SDNY) email Glen McGorty asking if his client recognizes an individual in a photo, as part of an ongoing investigation.

events.title: McGorty Agrees to Convey Information
events.description: Glen McGorty responds to prosecutors, stating they will circle up with his client and potentially schedule a call to discuss the photo and additional information.

events.title: Prosecutors Provide Detailed Background
events.description: Prosecutors send detailed information to McGorty about the individual in the photo, identifying him as a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee in Saint Thomas with connections to Jeffrey Epstein, to be conveyed to McGorty's client.

events.title: Scheduling of Follow-up Call
events.description: Email exchange finalizing a time for a call between McGorty and the prosecutors to discuss the client's response to the provided information.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's connections in July 2020, a year after his death.
The investigation involved a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) employee stationed in Saint Thomas who was friends with Epstein, visited his home, and accompanied him on various trips.
Prosecutors sought to identify individuals who may have been introduced to this CBP employee, suggesting an effort to map Epstein's network in the Virgin Islands.
Attorney Glen McGorty acted as an intermediary for an unnamed client ('Mr. [redacted]') who prosecutors believed might have information about the CBP employee.
The email chain demonstrates continued posthumous investigative efforts into Epstein's associates and activities.
